thread.title: After club party, night horror for youth
thread.title_full: After club party, night horror for youth

author: tribuneindia.com
title: After club party, night horror for youth
text:
Tribune News Service
Chandigarh, October 25
A man, who was returning from a night club along with his woman friend, was accosted by the occupants of two cars and shot in the waist at Sector 22 at 2.27 am last night. The victim, Deepak Saini, a resident of Sector 38, was returning from the night club in Sector 8 in an open Jeep when a Verna car, which had four occupants, blocked his way while two occupants of another car (Aveo) parked their vehicle right behind his Jeep near the Sector 22/23/17/16 roundabout. The victim alleged that the suspects, Rocky, Ranjeet, Manpreet and Lucky, were riding a Verna with a blue beacon atop it. He alleged that they asked him to alight from his car and started abusing him. “They asked me to hand over my Jeep to them which I refused,” he added. Deepak further alleged that in the meantime, Ranjit fired a shot at him which missed. Rocky fired another shot which hit him in the waist. The suspects then sped off. The victim drove to Government Multi Specialty Hospital (GMSH), Sector 16, and informed his family about the incident. The police have started investigation into the incident. The victim claimed that his woman friend, Simran, was also manhandled by the suspects. He had noted down the number of the Verna car, which bore a registration number of Amritsar. The victim is out of danger and is under observation. Sources said the suspects earlier lived at Kharar. They shifted to Zirakpur recently. The victim claimed that he knew the suspects as they also used to visit night clubs. However, he denied having any enmity with them. Inspector Uday Pal, SHO, Sector 17 police station, said: “We can’t disclose the names of the suspects in the case. Meanwhile, efforts are being made to arrest them.” A case under sections 307 (attempt to murder), 34 (acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention) of the IPC and under the Arms Act has been registered by the police at the Sector 17 police station against four persons and investigation initiated.
